newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek yield curve down and flat, FRNs, drachma up.
newsitem.headline: Greek yield curve down and flat, FRNs, drachma up.

text.p: Greece's interbank depo and forward curves were down and flat in late trade, buying interest for non-taxable FRNs drove their discount margins a few ticks lower and ecu/drachma was easier in its tight range, dealers said.
Sales of 12-month T-bills and two-year zeros hitting the market today did not cover expiries, dealers said.
Ecu/drachma was locked in familiar ranges, currently trading around 309.40/45.
"Depos and forex forwards have collapsed," said a dealer at a foreign bank. "Depos are hovering around 10.75 percent and implied drachma rates from forex forwards around 10.20/25 percent."
London-based investors chose to swap their drachmas for forex driving rates lower, he said.
Fixed coupon bonds were steady but buying interest for non-taxable seven-year floaters pushed their discount margins down to 75 basis points from 78 earlier, a bond dealer at a private bank said.
Early indications pointed to sales of 12-month T-bills and two-year zeros falling short of expiries. About 200 billion drachmas of 12-month T-bills expire today.
Greece issued 12-month T-bills and two-year zeros at a gross rate of 9.60 percent and 9.50 percent respectively today.
The mark was quoted at 157.32/42 from Tuesday's 157.370 fix, the dollar at 274.52/62 drachmas from 274.700 and the ecu at 309.17/27 from 309.31 drachmas.

"Ecu/drachma is trading close to the lower end of its 309.20/45 range," said a senior dealer at a foreign bank. "It has eased on thin ecu selling and this makes me believe that a trend reversal could be in the offing."
Many players run short ecu/drachma positions and it suits them to keep the exchange rate low, the dealer said.
Dealers said mark was very weak against EMS currencies and the drachma lately and this could also be reversed.

"EMU-related fears have weakened the mark but mark/drachma is too low at current levels. This could explain why New York-based investors have come out and buy it," said a senior dealer at a private bank.
The National Bank of Greece quoted the following late rates:
** Overnight at 9.90-10.40
** One week at 10.30-10.80
** Two weeks at 10.30-10.80
** Three weeks at 10.30-10.80
** One month at 10.30-10.80
** Two months at 10.30-10.80
** Three months at 10.30-10.80
** Six months at 10.30-10.80
** Nine months at 10.30-10.80
** Twelve months at 10.30-10.80
